laboratory_examinations.findings: Baseline HCV RNA load was 2 million copies/mL; at the end of treatment, it had decreased by 4 logs and was undetectable. However, the HCV RNA load rebounded to 11 million copies/mL soon after completion of treatment.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Rising HCV RNA load after the completion of treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Results remained stable; serum alanine aminotransferase and aspartate aminotransferase levels, prothrombin and partial thromboplastin time were within normal limits. Albumin level was 3.4 g/dL (normal range 3.5-5.0 g/dL).
Pao2 was 59 mm Hg and Paco2 was 33 mm Hg.
Demonstrated mild airway obstruction (FEV1/FVC ratio was 73% of the predicted value) and moderately reduced diffusion capacity for carbon monoxide (57% of the predicted value).
Normal ejection fraction of 60%; air bubbles were observed in the left heart chambers within 3â€“4 cycles after their appearance in the right heart chambers with no intracardiac shunt detected.
